meanings.definition: A mast or sail above the topmast on a sailing ship.
meanings.sent1: The topgallant fluttered in the wind as the ship sailed smoothly.
meanings.sent2: The sailors climbed up to the topgallant to adjust the rigging.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous seagull perched on the topgallant, enjoying the view.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams soared high like a topgallant reaching for the sky.
meanings.sent5: The topgallant stood tall against the blue sky, a symbol of adventure.

meanings.definition: The highest point or peak of something.
meanings.sent1: The mountain's topgallant was covered in snow all year round.
meanings.sent2: Reaching the topgallant of the tower, she could see the entire city below.
meanings.sent3: The cat managed to climb to the topgallant of the tree and refused to come down.
meanings.sent4: His excitement reached the topgallant when he won the championship.
meanings.sent5: The sun set behind the topgallant of the hill, painting the sky in hues of orange.

meanings.sent1: She always aims to topgallant in her studies, striving for excellence.
meanings.sent2: The team managed to topgallant their previous record in the relay race.
meanings.sent3: The chef's signature dish never fails to topgallant in flavor and presentation.
meanings.sent4: His determination to topgallant in sports led him to victory.
meanings.sent5: The artist's masterpiece seemed to topgallant all others in the gallery, drawing everyone's attention.
